lexUnit.name: apprehensive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: anticipating with anxiety or fear.

sentence.text: Maryon felt quite apprehensive about the experiment and wondered what it would be like to live with Alan during the diet .
But he was slightly apprehensive about his most recent visit to London .
The others were very quiet , with excited , apprehensive looks on their faces .
Crofters were very apprehensive of the possible changes .
But the two ideas were similar enough for Darwin to feel very apprehensive when Wallace 's paper arrived .
This time last year we were very apprehensive about entering a year when so much doom and gloom was being talked about .
Several times at the beginning of his stay he had surprised a worried and apprehensive look on her face .
We glanced at each other , and I pulled a long , apprehensive face .
She threw her sister an apprehensive glance but was reassured to see she was smiling .
He was understandably apprehensive when Diana made her first speech partly in Welsh at Cardiff City Hall when she was presented with the Freedom of the City .
The public was apprehensive at the shortage of heat and light and the inconveniences of the three day working week .
Most of them seem apprehensive at the prospect of a possible loss of authority , failing to see that , on the contrary , their grip on matters would be greatly strengthened .

Discussion of them since 1962 had been frequent but hesitant : teachers , governors , parents in the various schools were apprehensive of large-scale and unpredictable change , and no firm decision was emerging .
We are both apprehensive of strong forces and we are both under necessity of taking precautions .
Less apprehensive of the weather now she knew it was due to improve , she was glad of permission to use the transistor .
Some of the marchers were apprehensive about this very hi-tech physiotherapy department .
They may not be unduly apprehensive about climate change , but they know about the greenhouse effect and how the state of the world and their own localities impinges on their lives .
But Beattie is a little apprehensive about the effect of what he has said .
He went off to the kitchen , leaving Leonora apprehensive about the rest of the evening .
On an early solo some pilots do get rather far from the field , which causes their instructors to become apprehensive for their safety .
Sir Sidney Barton was apprehensive for my safety and suggested I should join him and Lord Airlie on a short hunting trip near the Awash Station .
I 'm a bit apprehensive about seeing her again , but I 'm sure she 'll have fun seeing the old hag in her new colours .
We were apprehensive about crossing into Algeria .
Householders return home apprehensive of having been burgled .
Four pairs of suspicious , apprehensive eyes became suddenly full of relief .
Saul Quatt turned his apprehensive gaze upon the companion , his frown shifting the spectacles upon his nose .
Many nations are apprehensive because the treaty establishes no controls to prevent the ruthless industrial and trading practices that built Japan 's pre-war commercial empire .
She is apprehensive but she wants to see her husband and two sons .
